cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of discovering network topology in the presence of Byzantine faults, which is a fundamental problem in distributed computing. This problem is related to several sub-fields of computer science, including distributed computing (cs.DC), network protocols and architectures (cs.NI), graph algorithms and data structures (cs.DS), cryptography and security (cs.CR), and control systems (cs.SY). However, since the paper focuses on non-cryptographic solutions and graph connectivity bounds, cs.DC and cs.NI are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also presents solutions that have low message complexity, which is relevant to cs.DS. Finally, the problem of Byzantine-robust topology discovery is related to fault-tolerant control systems, which is relevant to cs.SY.
